< judgment of the figur given in plate—liv in london where we have few or no small cattl as in the countri i cannot give exampl of such creatur but i onc set the figur preced concern a dogg which is in the natur of small beast which dogg wa miss 
< the question to me wa what part of the citi they should search and if he should ever be recov 
< the querent wa signifi by the sign ascend and the lord thereof for in hi person he wa saturnin and vitiat accord to the dragon tail in the ascend in hi natur mind and understanding—that is he wa deform in bodi and of a covet disposit 
< the sign of the sixth hous and hi lord signifi the dogg for that sign stand for sheep hog and small cattl

> judgment of the figur given in plate—liv in london where we have few or no small cattl as in the countri i cannot give exampl of such creatur but i onc set the figur preced concern a dogg which is in the natur of small beast which dogg was miss

5409,5411c5409,5411
< the strength of the testimoni be thu examin i found the plural to signifi the west and therefor i judg that the dogg ought to be westward from the place where the owner live which wa at templ bar wherefor i judg that the dogg wa about long acr or the upper part of druri lane 
< in regard that mercuri the signif of the beast wa in a sign of the same triplic as gemini the ascend which signifi london and appli to a trine aspect of the cusp of the sixth hous i judg that the dogg wa not out of the line of commun but wa in the same quarter of which i wa more confirm by the trine of the sun and saturn 
< the sign in which mercuri appear wa libra—an airi sign therefor i judg that the dogg wa in some chamber or upper room and kept privat or in great secreci becaus the moon wa under the beam of the sun and mercuri the moon and the sun were in the eighth hous and becaus the sun on the monday follow would appli by trine to saturn the lord of the ascend and the moon to trine of mar have exalt in the ascend i intim to the owner of the beast that in my opinion he should have hi dogg again or news of hi dogg or small beast upon the monday follow or near that time which wa true for a gentleman of the querent acquaint sent home the dogg the veri same day about ten in the morn who by accid come to see a friend in long acr found the dogg chain up under a tabl and know the dogg to be the querent sent him home as abov said to my veri great credit and no doubt also to the great satisfact of the dogg himself 
---
> the strength of the testimoni be thus examin i found the plural to signifi the west and therefor i judg that the dogg ought to be westward from the place where the owner live which was at templ bar wherefor i judg that the dogg was about long acr or the upper part of druri lane 
> in regard that mercuri the signif of the beast was in a sign of the same triplic as gemini the ascend which signifi london and appli to a trine aspect of the cusp of the sixth hous i judg that the dogg was not out of the line of communic but was in the same quarter of which i was more confirm by the trine of the sun and saturn

< solar horoscopes15 january—aquariu the influenc of thi sign last from the twentysecond of januari to the twentyfirst of februari 
< the man born under thi influenc will be of medium statur good geniu and a great speaker 
< he will achiev what he desir and will becom famou in hi own countri 
< he will be subject to melancholi veri religi and of a highli conscienti natur 
< the star howev destin him to pass through much poverti in hi youth and he will have other troubl in the matter of death of relat and friend befor he is thirti 
< he will travel much and in hi earli youth he will suffer from ill 
< he will be much influenc by women to hi own detriment 
< he will lose hi first wife and will marri twice but the second marriag will not be veri fortun 
---

< chaucer’ astronomi 27 v astrolog lore in chaucer 51 appendix 79 pg 3 astronom lore in chaucer i astronomi in the middl age the conspicu of astronom lore in the poetri of chaucer is due to it import in the life of hi centuri 
< in the mediaev period astronomi or ‘astrology’ for the two name were use indiffer to cover the same subject wa one of the vital interest of men 
< the ordinari man of the middl age knew much more than do most men today about the phenomena of the heaven conveni such as clock almanac and chart repres celesti phenomena were rare and direct observ of the appar movement and the rel posit of the heavenli bodi were necessari for the regul of man’ daili occup 
< furthermor the belief in a geocentr system of the univers which in chaucer’ centuri wa almost univers accept wa of vast signific in man’ way of think 
< accept thi view all the heavenli bodi seem to have been creat for the sole benefit of man inhabit the central posit in the univers their movement alway with refer to the earth as a center brought to man light heat chang of season—al the condit that made human life possibl on the earth 
< not onli did the man of the middl age see in the regular movement of the celesti sphere the instrument by which god grant him physic exist but in the variou aspect of heavenli phenomena he saw the govern principl of hi moral life 
< the arrang of the heavenli bodi with regard to one anoth at variou time wa suppos to exert undoubt power over the cours of terrestri event 
< each planet wa thought to have special attribut and a special influenc over men’spg 4 live 
< venu wa the planet of love mar of war and hostil the sun of power and honor and so forth 
< each wa mysteri connect with a certain color with a metal too the alchemist said and each had special power over some organ of the human bodi 
< the planet’ influenc wa believ to vari greatli accord to it posit in the heaven so that to determin a man’ destini accur it wa necessari to consid the aspect of the whole heaven especi at the moment of hi birth but also at other time 
< thi wa call “cast the horoscope� and wa regard as of great import in enabl a man to guard against threaten peril or bad tendenc and to make the best use of favor opportun 
---
> chaucer’ astronomi 27 v astrolog lore in chaucer 51 appendix 79 pg 3 astronom lore in chaucer i astronomi in the middl age the conspicu of astronom lore in the poetri of chaucer is due to it import in the life of his centuri 
> in the mediaev period astronomi or ‘astrology’ for the two name were use indiffer to cover the same subject was one of the vital interest of men 
> the ordinari man of the middl age knew much more than do most men today about the phenomena of the heaven conveni such as clock almanac and chart repres celesti phenomena were rare and direct observ of the appar movement and the relat posit of the heaven bodi were necessari for the regul of man’ daili occup 
> furthermor the belief in a geocentr system of the univers which in chaucer’ centuri was almost univers accept was of vast signific in man’ way of think 
> accept this view all the heaven bodi seem to have been creat for the sole benefit of man inhabit the central posit in the univers their movement alway with refer to the earth as a center brought to man light heat chang of season—al the condit that made human life possibl on the earth 
> not onli did the man of the middl age see in the regular movement of the celesti sphere the instrument by which god grant him physic exist but in the various aspect of heaven phenomena he saw the govern principl of his moral life 
> the arrang of the heaven bodi with regard to one anoth at various time was suppos to exert undoubt power over the cours of terrestri event 
> each planet was thought to have special attribut and a special influenc over men’spg 4 live 
> venus was the planet of love mar of war and hostil the sun of power and honor and so forth 
> each was mysteri connect with a certain color with a metal too the alchemist said and each had special power over some organ of the human bodi 
> the planet’ influenc was believ to vari great accord to it posit in the heaven so that to determin a man’ destini accur it was necessari to consid the aspect of the whole heaven especi at the moment of his birth but also at other time 
> this was call “cast the horoscope� and was regard as of great import in enabl a man to guard against threaten peril or bad tendenc and to make the best use of favor opportun

< the ptolema system owe it name to the famou alexandrian astronom of the second centuri a d claudiu ptolemi but is base larg on the work and discoveri of the earlier greek philosoph and astronom especi eudoxu hipparchu and aristarchu whose investig ptolemi compiledpg 5 and along some line extend 
< ptolema astronomi wa a pure geometr or mathemat system which repres the observ movement and rel posit of the heavenli bodi so accur that calcul as to their posit at ani given time could be base upon it 
< ptolemi agre with hi contemporari in the opinion that to assign caus for the celesti movement wa outsid the sphere of the astronom 
< thi wa a proper field of philosophi and the decis of philosoph especi those of aristotl were regard as final and their teach as the basi upon which observ phenomena should be describ 
---
> the ptolema system owe it name to the famous alexandrian astronom of the second centuri a d claudius ptolemi but is base larg on the work and discoveri of the earlier greek philosoph and astronom especi eudoxus hipparchus and aristarchus whose investig ptolemi compiledpg 5 and along some line extend 
> ptolema astronomi was a pure geometr or mathemat system which repres the observ movement and relat posit of the heaven bodi so accur that calcul as to their posit at ani given time could be base upon it 
> ptolemi agre with his contemporari in the opinion that to assign caus for the celesti movement was outsid the sphere of the astronom 
> this was a proper field of philosophi and the decis of philosoph especi those of aristotl were regard as final and their teach as the basi upon which observ phenomena should be describ 
6390,6393c6390,6393
< it can have no motion for there must be some fix point in the univers to which all the motion of the heavenli bodi may be refer if the earth had motion it wa argu thi would be proportion to the great mass of the earth and would caus object and anim to fli off into the air and be left behind 
< ptolemi believ thi reason suffici to make unten the idea of a rotatori motion of the earth although he wa fulli awar that to suppos such a motion of the earth would simplifi exceedingli the represent of the celesti movement 
< it did not occur to him that to suppos the earth’ atmospher to particip in it motion would obviat thi difficulti 
< the earth wa but a point in comparison with the immens sphere to which the star were attach and which revolv about the earth onc in everi twentyfour hour impart it motion to sun moon and planet thu caus day and night and the rise and set of the heavenli bodi 
---
> it can have no motion for there must be some fix point in the univers to which all the motion of the heaven bodi may be refer if the earth had motion it was argu this would be proportion to the great mass of the earth and would caus object and anim to fli off into the air and be left behind 
> ptolemi believ this reason suffici to make unten the idea of a rotatori motion of the earth although he was fulli awar that to suppos such a motion of the earth would simplifi exceed the represent of the celesti movement 
> it did not occur to him that to suppos the earth’ atmospher to particip in it motion would obviat this difficulti 
> the earth was but a point in comparison with the immens sphere to which the star were attach and which revolv about the earth onc in everi twentyfour hour impart it motion to sun moon and planet thus caus day and night and the rise and set of the heaven bodi

---

> pg 6though it was a pure mathemat system which onli attempt to give a basi for comput celesti motion ptolema astronomi is of great import histor as it remain the foundat of theoret astronomi for more than 1400 year

< the idea of four elements38 ha it origin in the attempt of the earli greek cosmologist to discov the ultim principl of realiti in the univers 
< thale reach the conclus that thi principl wa water anaximin that it wa air and heracleitu fire while parmenid suppos two element fire or light subtl and rarefi and earth or night dens and heavi 
< empedocl of agrigentum about 450 b c assum as primari element all four—fir air water and earth—of which each of hi predecessor had assum onli one or two 
< to explain the manifold phenomena of natur he suppos them to be produc by combin of the element in differ proport through the attract and repuls forc of ‘love’ and ‘discord’ thi arbitrari assumpt of four element first made by empedocl persist in the popular imagin throughout the middl age and is like other cosmolog idea of antiqu sometim reflect in the poetri of the time

> the idea of four elements38 has it origin in the attempt of the earli greek cosmologist to discov the ultim principl of realiti in the univers 
> thale reach the conclus that this principl was water anaximin that it was air and heracleitus fire while parmenid suppos two element fire or light subtl and rarefi and earth or night dens and heavi 
> empedocl of agrigentum about 450 b c assum as primari element all four—fir air water and earth—of which each of his predecessor had assum onli one or two 
> to explain the manifold phenomena of natur he suppos them to be produc by combin of the element in differ proport through the attract and repuls forc of ‘love’ and ‘discord’ this arbitrari assumpt of four element first made by empedocl persist in the popular imagin throughout the middl age and is like other cosmolog idea of antiqu sometim reflect in the poetri of the time

> the basi of this faith was not altogeth illog but contain a germ of truth 
> of all the heaven bodi the sun exert the most obvious effect upon the earth the sun brought day and night summer and winter his ray lure grow thing from mother earth and so gave susten to mankind 
> but to the ancient peopl of the orient the sun was also often a bane power he could destroy as well as give life

< from thi begin base as we have seen on a germ of fact by the power of hi imagin and credul man extend more and more the power of these sider divin attribut to their volit and influenc all the most insignific as well as the most import terrestri event

6534,6540c6534,6540
< it wa but a step from faith in stellar influenc on our earth to the belief that as the heavenli movement were govern by immut law so their influenc upon the world would follow certain law and it effect in the futur could be determin as certainli as could the come revolut and conjunct of the star 
< out of thi twofold belief wa evolv a complex system of divin the origin of which wa forgotten as men believ in it invent reason for believ pretend that their faith wa found on a long seri of observ 
< the chaldean believ that in discov the unceas regular of the celesti motion they had found the veri law of life and they built upon thi convict a mass of absolut rigid dogma 
< but when experi beli these dogma unabl to realiz the falsiti of their presupposit and to give up their faith in the divin star the astrolog invent new dogma to explain the old one thu pile up a bodi of complic and oftenpg 53 contradictori doctrin that will ever be to the student a sourc of perplex and astonish 
< on it philosoph side astrolog wa a system of astral theolog develop not by popular thought but through the care observ and specul of learn priest and scholar 
< it wa a pure eastern scienc which came into be on the chaldean plain and in the nile valley 
< as far as we know it wa entir unknown to ani of the primit aryan race from hindostan to scandinavia 
---
> it was but a step from faith in stellar influenc on our earth to the belief that as the heaven movement were govern by immut law so their influenc upon the world would follow certain law and it effect in the futur could be determin as certain as could the come revolut and conjunct of the star 
> out of this twofold belief was evolv a complex system of divin the origin of which was forgotten as men believ in it invent reason for believ pretend that their faith was found on a long seri of observ 
> the chaldean believ that in discov the unceas regular of the celesti motion they had found the veri law of life and they built upon this convict a mass of absolut rigid dogma 
> but when experi beli these dogma unabl to realiz the falsiti of their presupposit and to give up their faith in the divin star the astrolog invent new dogma to explain the old one thus pile up a bodi of complic and oftenpg 53 contradictori doctrin that will ever be to the student a sourc of perplex and astonish 
> on it philosoph side astrolog was a system of astral theolog develop not by popular thought but through the care observ and specul of learn priest and scholar 
> it was a pure eastern scienc which came into be on the chaldean plain and in the nile valley 
> as far as we know it was entir unknown to ani of the primit aryan race from hindostan to scandinavia

> in the hellenist period zeno the stoic and his follow proclaim the supremaci of the sider divin even more strong than the school of plato and aristotl had done 
> the stoic conceiv the world as a great organ whose “sympathetic� forc constant interact upon one anoth govern by reason which was of the essenc of ether fire the primordi substanc of the univers 
> to the star the purest manifest of the power of this ether substanc were attribut the greatest influenc and the loftiest divin qualiti 
> the stoic develop the doctrin of fatal which is the inevit outcom of faith in stellar influenc on human life to it consequ yet they prove by fact that fatal is not incompat with pg 54activ and virtuous live

< thi studi is sometim call palmistri in which case howev it properli refer onli to a judgment form from what appear in the palm of the hand whilst chirom taken from the word cheir a hand and manteia divin signifi the revel made by the hand taken as a whole

> chirom and it origin chirom is a scienc which teach us to read not onli the charact but the whole destiny—for good or evil the length of life and often the manner of death of a man by the line and mark to be seen in his hand 
> this studi is sometim call palmistri in which case howev it proper refer onli to a judgment form from what appear in the palm of the hand whilst chirom taken from the word cheir a hand and manteia divin signifi the revel made by the hand taken as a whole 
> chirom is near as ancient as astrolog with which it is indissolubl connect for the hand repres as has been befor said a natur horoscop which is place upon it at the time both of the concept and the birth by the influenc of the star

> the necess of silenc was in fact one of the princip tenet of the kabbala and is repres in the figur of addanari16 by the posit of the finger of the hand hold the flower branch of abund the thumb and the first two finger which in chirom repres will power and fatal are held open whilst the third and fourth finger repres light and scienc are close

> then instant did he do a thing that made mypg 175 blood run cold 
> with a toss of the scarf into the air he form it into a noos and this he threw over one upbend knee 
> next with a swift twist of fierc hand he drew the knot tight and so terribl realist was his action that for the moment i saw abov his knee the contort mouth and protrud eye of his sudden strangl victim 
> there was horror in my gaze now but onli calm profession pride in his as he flung back the still loop and knot kerchief on to the carpet 
> yes i am a strangler he said calm as are all the thug born to becom strangler and taught how to use the roomal in earli youth by their own father hand 
> of strangl as a mean of murder i of cours knew and inde dure the year of my magistraci i had heard vagu rumour of robber habitu resort to this method of dispatch their victim rather than to club or sword 
> but such appal dexter as this man display in the handl of an innocentlook silken scarf i had never imagin
